cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to track WNW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then turn northwest over the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and approach the northwest Gulf Coast (LA/TX border area) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southwest Louisiana coast near Lake Charles/Cameron Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast to southeast Louisiana likely to experience impacts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible at Port Arthur by Wednesday with a low (but increasing) chance of 50-kt gusts if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge of several feet along Sabine Pass and the lower Sabine–Neches waterway, including Port Arthur.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash flooding in low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands and possible prolonged power outages that could disrupt cargo handling.
